comment: Irish Whiskey  single malt bit harsh like most of these whiskey single malts

I'll admit I've never even heard of Locke's, but it's pretty outstanding.  A lot in common with DoubleWood, with honey being prominent.  Sweet peach and ripe melon present too.  I don't get the peat yet the finish is rich, if not quite as heavy as DW.
Whisky goûté en irlande dans une distillerie autrefois fermée, petit coups de cœur !
Lots of flavours. Easy to drink.

Big shot of vanilla on the nose.

Tasted with an ice-cube, lots of spice first, followed by sweet notes and a barest hint of smoke on the finish. I wouldn't say it's very complex, but it is very enjoyable.
Smokey the Bear is offended by this peaty mess
a great Irish with a little medicinal funk in the beginning. probably wouldnt buy a bottle
On the front a bit of milk chocolate, peach, then peat. The sweet doesn’t balance we with the peat.
